summary.span: 提供關於日期和時間值格式的特定文化特性資訊。

span.span: Provides culture-specific information about the format of date and time values.

remarks.format:
## Remarks 屬性類別包含特定文化特性資訊來格式化或剖析日期和時間值，如下所示：The properties of the class contain culture-specific information for formatting or parsing date and time values such as the following: - 用來格式化日期值的模式。The patterns used to format date values. - 用來格式化時間值的模式。The patterns used to format time values. - 一周天數名稱。The names of the days of the week. - 年度月份名稱。The names of the months of the year. - A.m.The A.M. 和下午and P.M. 時間值中的指示項。designators used in time values. - 日期以行事曆。The calendar in which dates are expressed. 本節內容：In this section: - [DateTimeFormatInfo 物件具現化Instantiating a DateTimeFormatInfo object](#instantiating) - [而異的文化特性For the Invariant Culture](#instantiating_Invariant) - [特定文化特性For a Specific Culture](#instantiating_Specific) - [中性文化特性For a neutral culture](#instantiating_neutral) - [目前的文化特性For the current culture](#instantiating_Current) - [DateTimeFormatInfo 和動態資料DateTimeFormatInfo and dynamic data](#dynamic) - [格式化日期和時間Formatting dates and times](#Formatting_dates_times) - [格式字串和 DateTimeFormatInfo 屬性Format strings and DateTimeFormatInfo properties](#format-strings-and-datetimeformatinfo-properties) - [修改 DateTimeFormatInfo 屬性Modifying DateTimeFormatInfo properties](#Modifying) ## DateTimeFormatInfo 物件具現化Instantiating a DateTimeFormatInfo object A物件可以代表而異的文化特性、 特定文化特性、 中性文化特性或目前的文化特性的格式化慣例。A object can represent the formatting conventions of the invariant culture, a specific culture, a neutral culture, or the current culture. 本節討論如何具現化每一種物件。This section discusses how to instantiate each type of object. ### 具現化而異的文化特性之 DateTimeFormatInfo 物件Instantiating a DateTimeFormatInfo object for the invariant culture 文化特性而異表示不區分文化特性的文化特性。The invariant culture represents a culture that is culture-insensitive. 它採用有關英文的語言，但不是能在任何特定英文國家/地區。It is based on the English language, but not on any specific English-speaking country/region. 雖然特定文化特性的資料可以是動態的而且能夠變更以反映新的文化特性慣例或使用者的喜好設定，而異的文化特性的資料不會變更。Although the data of specific cultures can be dynamic and can change to reflect new cultural conventions or user preferences, the data of the invariant culture does not change. 您可以具現化物件，表示不區分文化特性的格式化慣例如下：You can instantiate a object that represents the formatting conventions of the invariant culture in the following ways: - 所擷取的值屬性。By retrieving the value of the property. 傳回物件是唯讀的。The returned object is read-only. - 藉由呼叫無參數建構函式。By calling the parameterless constructor. 傳回的 物件是讀取/寫入。The returned object is read/write. - 所擷取的值屬性從所傳回的物件屬性。By retrieving the value of the property from the object that is returned by the property. 傳回物件是唯讀的。The returned object is read-only. 下列範例所使用的是每一種方法來具現化物件，表示文化特性而異。The following example uses each of these methods to instantiate a object that represents the invariant culture. 然後會指出物件是否唯讀。It then indicates whether the object is read-only. [!code-csharp[System.Globalization.DateTimeFormatInfo.Class#1](~/samples/snippets/csharp/VS_Snippets_CLR_System/system.globalization.datetimeformatinfo.class/cs/create1.cs#1)] [!code-vb[System.Globalization.DateTimeFormatInfo.Class#1](~/samples/snippets/visualbasic/VS_Snippets_CLR_System/system.globalization.datetimeformatinfo.class/vb/create1.vb#1)] ### 特定文化特性之 DateTimeFormatInfo 物件具現化Instantiating a DateTimeFormatInfo object for a specific culture 特定文化特性代表特定國家/地區中使用的語言。A specific culture represents a language that is spoken in a particular country/region. 例如，EN-US 代表美國境內的英文語言的特定文化特性而 en CA，代表加拿大英文語言特定文化特性。For example, en-US is a specific culture that represents the English language spoken in the United States, and en-CA is a specific culture that represents the English language spoken in Canada. 您可以具現化物件，代表特定文化特性的格式化慣例如下：You can instantiate a object that represents the formatting conventions of a specific culture in the following ways: - 藉由呼叫方法，並擷取傳回的值物件的屬性。By calling the method and retrieving the value of the returned object's property. 傳回物件是唯讀的。The returned object is read-only. - 藉由傳遞靜態方法物件，表示文化特性的您想要擷取的物件。By passing the static method a object that represents the culture whose object you want to retrieve. 傳回的 物件是讀取/寫入。The returned object is read/write. - 藉由呼叫靜態方法，並擷取傳回的值物件的屬性。By calling the static method and retrieving the value of the returned object's property. 傳回的 物件是讀取/寫入。The returned object is read/write. - 藉由呼叫類別建構函式並擷取傳回的值物件的屬性。By calling the class constructor and retrieving the value of the returned object's property. 傳回的 物件是讀取/寫入。The returned object is read/write. 下列範例說明每種方式來具現化物件，並指出產生的物件是否為唯讀。The following example illustrates each of these ways to instantiate a object and indicates whether the resulting object is read-only. [!code-csharp[System.Globalization.DateTimeFormatInfo.Class#3](~/samples/snippets/csharp/VS_Snippets_CLR_System/system.globalization.datetimeformatinfo.class/cs/create1.cs#3)] [!code-vb[System.Globalization.DateTimeFormatInfo.Class#3](~/samples/snippets/visualbasic/VS_Snippets_CLR_System/system.globalization.datetimeformatinfo.class/vb/create1.vb#3)] ### 中性文化特性之 DateTimeFormatInfo 物件具現化Instantiating a DateTimeFormatInfo object for a neutral culture 中性文化特性表示文化特性或語言無關的國家/地區;它通常是一或多個特定的文化特性的父代。A neutral culture represents a culture or language that is independent of a country/region; it is typically the parent of one or more specific cultures. 比方說，Fr 是法文的語言和父代為 FR-FR 文化特性的中性文化特性。For example, Fr is a neutral culture for the French language and the parent of the fr-FR culture. 您可以具現化物件，代表中性文化特性的格式化慣例，您所建立的相同方式物件，代表特定文化特性的格式化慣例。You can instantiate a object that represents the formatting conventions of a neutral culture in the same ways that you create a object that represents the formatting conventions of a specific culture. 此外，您可以在其中擷取中性文化特性物件擷取特定文化特性的中性文化特性屬性並擷取所傳回的物件及其屬性。In addition, you can retrieve a neutral culture's object by retrieving a neutral culture from a specific culture's property and retrieving the object returned by its property. 除非父文化特性表示文化特性而異，傳回的物件是讀取/寫入。Unless the parent culture represents the invariant culture, the returned object is read/write. 下列範例將說明這些方式具現化代表中性文化特性的物件。The following example illustrates these ways of instantiating a object that represents a neutral culture. [!code-csharp[System.Globalization.DateTimeFormatInfo.Class#2](~/samples/snippets/csharp/VS_Snippets_CLR_System/system.globalization.datetimeformatinfo.class/cs/create1.cs#2)] [!code-vb[System.Globalization.DateTimeFormatInfo.Class#2](~/samples/snippets/visualbasic/VS_Snippets_CLR_System/system.globalization.datetimeformatinfo.class/vb/create1.vb#2)] > [!NOTE] > 在.NET framework 1.0 透過[!INCLUDE[net_v35_short](~/includes/net-v35-short-md.md)]，嘗試擷取物件會反映中性文化特性的格式化慣例，會擲回例外狀況。In the .NET Framework versions 1.0 through [!INCLUDE[net_v35_short](~/includes/net-v35-short-md.md)], trying to retrieve a object that reflects the formatting conventions of a neutral culture throws a exception. 不過，由於中性文化特性缺少特定文化特性格式資訊，因為它是獨立於特定國家/地區。However, a neutral culture lacks culture-specific formatting information, because it is independent of a specific country/region. 而不是填入物件使用泛型值，.NET Framework 會傳回反映的格式化慣例的特定文化特性的物件是中性文化特性的子系。Instead of populating the object with generic values, the .NET Framework returns a object that reflects the formatting conventions of a specific culture that is a child of the neutral culture. 例如，物件的中性 en-us 文化特性會反映 EN-US 文化特性的格式化慣例，物件為 fr 文化特性反映 FR-FR 文化特性的格式化慣例。For example, the object for the neutral en culture reflects the formatting conventions of the en-US culture, and the object for the fr culture reflects the formatting conventions of the fr-FR culture. 您可以使用如下的程式碼，以判斷哪一個特定文化特性的中性文化特性所表示的格式化慣例。You can use code like the following to determine which specific culture's formatting conventions a neutral culture represents. 此範例使用反映來比較具有屬性的特定子文化特性的中性文化特性屬性。The example uses reflection to compare the properties of a neutral culture with the properties of a specific child culture. 它會考慮為相等，如果它們都是相同的日曆類型的兩個行事曆，西曆的行事曆，如果其屬性有相同的值。It considers two calendars to be equivalent if they are the same calendar type and, for Gregorian calendars, if their properties have identical values. [!code-csharp[System.Globalization.DateTimeFormatInfo.Class#6](~/samples/snippets/csharp/VS_Snippets_CLR_System/system.globalization.datetimeformatinfo.class/cs/instantiate6c.cs#6)] [!code-vb[System.Globalization.DateTimeFormatInfo.Class#6](~/samples/snippets/visualbasic/VS_Snippets_CLR_System/system.globalization.datetimeformatinfo.class/vb/instantiate6c.vb#6)] ### 目前的文化特性之 DateTimeFormatInfo 物件具現化Instantiating a DateTimeFormatInfo object for the current culture 您可以具現化物件，表示目前的文化特性的格式化慣例如下：You can instantiate a object that represents the formatting conventions of the current culture in the following ways: - 所擷取的值屬性。By retrieving the value of the property. 傳回物件是唯讀的。The returned object is read-only. - 所擷取的值屬性從所傳回的物件屬性。By retrieving the value of the property from the object that is returned by the property. 傳回物件是唯讀的。The returned object is read-only. - 藉由呼叫方法使用物件，表示目前的文化特性。By calling the method with a object that represents the current culture. 傳回物件是唯讀的。The returned object is read-only. 下列範例所使用的是每一種方法來具現化物件，表示目前的文化特性的格式化慣例。The following example uses each of these methods to instantiate a object that represents the formatting conventions of the current culture. 然後會指出物件是否唯讀。It then indicates whether the object is read-only. [!code-csharp[System.Globalization.DateTimeFormatInfo.Class#4](~/samples/snippets/csharp/VS_Snippets_CLR_System/system.globalization.datetimeformatinfo.class/cs/create2.cs#4)] [!code-vb[System.Globalization.DateTimeFormatInfo.Class#4](~/samples/snippets/visualbasic/VS_Snippets_CLR_System/system.globalization.datetimeformatinfo.class/vb/create2.vb#4)] 您可以建立可寫入物件，表示下列其中一種在目前執行緒文化特性的慣例：You can create a writable object that represents the conventions of the current thread culture in one of these ways: - 藉由擷取中的任何三個先前的方式和呼叫物件方法在傳回物件。By retrieving a object in any of the three previous ways and calling the method on the returned object. 這會建立一份原始物件，不同之處在於其屬性是`false`。This creates a copy of the original object, except that its property is `false`. - 藉由呼叫方法用來建立物件，代表目前的文化特性，並接著使用及其屬性，以擷取物件。By calling the method to create a object that represents the current culture, and then using its property to retrieve the object. 下列範例說明每種方法具現化讀取/寫入物件，並顯示的值及其屬性。The following example illustrates each way of instantiating a read/write object and displays the value of its property. [!code-csharp[System.Globalization.DateTimeFormatInfo.Class#7](~/samples/snippets/csharp/VS_Snippets_CLR_System/system.globalization.datetimeformatinfo.class/cs/instantiate2.cs#7)] [!code-vb[System.Globalization.DateTimeFormatInfo.Class#7](~/samples/snippets/visualbasic/VS_Snippets_CLR_System/system.globalization.datetimeformatinfo.class/vb/instantiate2.vb#7)] 在 Windows 中，使用者可以覆寫的一些格式化和剖析透過作業中所使用的屬性值**地區和語言**控制項台中應用程式。In Windows, the user can override some of the property values used in formatting and parsing operations through the **Region and Language** application in Control Panel. 比方說，文化特性是英文 （美國） 的使用者可能會選擇顯示長時間使用 24 小時制 （格式為 hh: mm:） 的時間值，而不是預設 12 小時制時間 （以格式 h:mm: ss tt 中)。For example, a user whose culture is English (United States) might choose to display long time values using a 24-hour clock (in the format HH:mm:ss) instead of the default 12-hour clock (in the format h:mm:ss tt). 物件中所討論的方式擷取先前所有反映這些使用者覆寫。The objects retrieved in the ways discussed previously all reflect these user overrides. 如果這不需要，您可以建立不會反映使用者的物件會覆寫 （和也是讀取/寫入，而不是唯讀） 藉由呼叫建構函式，並提供值為`false`如`useUserOverride`引數。If this is undesirable, you can create a object that does not reflect user overrides (and is also read/write instead of read-only) by calling the constructor and supplying a value of `false` for the `useUserOverride` argument. 下列範例說明這系統目前文化特性是英文 （美國） 和其完整時間模式已從 h:mm: ss tt 預設值變更為 hh: mm:。The following example illustrates this for a system whose current culture is English (United States) and whose long time pattern has been changed from the default of h:mm:ss tt to HH:mm:ss. [!code-csharp[System.Globalization.DateTimeFormatInfo.Class#8](~/samples/snippets/csharp/VS_Snippets_CLR_System/system.globalization.datetimeformatinfo.class/cs/instantiate3.cs#8)] [!code-vb[System.Globalization.DateTimeFormatInfo.Class#8](~/samples/snippets/visualbasic/VS_Snippets_CLR_System/system.globalization.datetimeformatinfo.class/vb/instantiate3.vb#8)] ## DateTimeFormatInfo 和動態資料DateTimeFormatInfo and dynamic data 格式化日期和時間值所提供的特定文化特性的資料類別是動態的就如同所提供的文化特性資料類別。The culture-specific data for formatting date and time values provided by the class is dynamic, just like cultural data provided by the class. 您不應建立穩定性值的任何假設相關聯的物件與特定物件。You should not make any assumptions about the stability of values for objects that are associated with particular objects. 只提供區分文化特性和其相關聯的資料物件很穩定。Only the data provided by the invariant culture and its associated object is stable. 其他資料可以在應用程式工作階段之間，或甚至在您的應用程式正在執行時，才變更。Other data can change between application sessions or even while your application is running. 有四個主要的來源的變更：There are four major sources of change: - 系統更新。System updates. 例如慣用的行事曆或自訂日期和時間格式的文化特性喜好設定會隨著時間改變。Cultural preferences such as the preferred calendar or customary date and time formats change over time. Windows Update 時若發生這種情況，包括變更特定文化特性的屬性值。When this happens, Windows Update includes changes to the property value for a particular culture. - 取代的文化特性。Replacement cultures. 類別可以用來取代現有的文化特性的資料。The class can be used to replace the data of an existing culture. - 階層式屬性值的變更。Cascading changes to property values. 一些文化特性相關的屬性可以變更在執行階段，這又會導致若要變更的資料。A number of culture-related properties can change at run time, which, in turn, causes data to change. 例如，以程式設計方式或透過使用者的動作，可以變更目前的文化特性。For example, the current culture can be changed either programmatically or through user action. 當發生這種情況所傳回的物件屬性變更為目前的文化特性相關聯的物件。When this happens, the object returned by the property changes to an object associated with the current culture. 同樣地，文化特性的曆法可以變更，從而會導致變更許多屬性值。Similarly, a culture's calendar can change, which can result in changes to numerous property values. - 使用者喜好設定。User preferences. 應用程式的使用者可以選擇覆寫一些透過控制台地區及語言選項的目前系統文化特性相關聯的值。Users of your application might choose to override some of the values associated with the current system culture through the regional and language options in Control Panel. 例如，使用者可能會選擇不同的格式顯示日期。For example, users might choose to display the date in a different format. 如果屬性設定為`true`，屬性物件也會從使用者設定。If the property is set to `true`, the properties of the object is also retrieved from the user settings. 如果使用者設定都與相關聯的文化特性不相容物件 (例如，如果所選行事曆不是其中一個所指示的行事曆屬性)，方法和屬性的值的結果為未定義。If the user settings are incompatible with the culture associated with the object (for example, if the selected calendar is not one of the calendars indicated by the property), the results of the methods and the values of the properties are undefined. 資料不一致，使用中的所有使用者可覆寫屬性的可能性降到最低建立物件時，會初始化物件。To minimize the possibility of inconsistent data, all user-overridable properties of a object are initialized when the object is created. 仍有可能不一致，因為建立物件和使用者覆寫程序都不是不可部分完成，而且相關的值可以在建立物件期間變更。There is still a possibility of inconsistency, because neither object creation nor the user override process is atomic and the relevant values can change during object creation. 不過，這種情況應該很少發生。However, this situation should be extremely rare. 您可以控制使用者覆寫是否會反映在代表相同的文化特性，與系統文化特性的物件。You can control whether user overrides are reflected in objects that represent the same culture as the system culture. 下表列出的方式物件可以擷取，並指出是否產生的物件會反映使用者覆寫。The following table lists the ways in which a object can be retrieved and indicates whether the resulting object reflects user overrides. |CultureInfo 和 DateTimeFormatInfo 物件的來源Source of CultureInfo and DateTimeFormatInfo object|會反映使用者覆寫Reflects user overrides| |---------------------------------------------------------|-----------------------------| |`CultureInfo.CurrentCulture.DateTimeFormat` 屬性`CultureInfo.CurrentCulture.DateTimeFormat` property|[是]Yes| | 屬性 property|[是]Yes| | 方法 method|是Yes| | 方法 method|否No| | 建構函式 constructor|是Yes| | 建構函式 constructor|取決於值`useUserOverride`參數Depends on value of `useUserOverride` parameter| 除非有充分的理由，否則您就應該採用使用者覆寫，當您使用格式化和剖析使用者輸入，或顯示資料的用戶端應用程式中的物件。Unless there is a compelling reason to do otherwise, you should respect user overrides when you use the object in client applications to format and parse user input or to display data. 針對伺服器應用程式或自動執行應用程式，您不應該。For server applications or unattended applications, you should not. 不過，如果您使用物件是明確或隱含方式來保存字串形式的日期和時間資料，您應該使用反映格式設定慣例的文化特性而異，或您的物件應該指定自訂日期和時間格式字串，您不論文化特性為何。However, if you are using the object either explicitly or implicitly to persist date and time data in string form, you should either use a object that reflects the formatting conventions of the invariant culture, or you should specify a custom date and time format string that you use regardless of culture. ## 格式化日期和時間Formatting dates and times A物件會隱含或明確地在所有日期和時間格式化作業。A object is used implicitly or explicitly in all date and time formatting operations. 這些包括呼叫下列方法：These include calls to the following methods: - 所有日期和時間格式化方法，例如和。All date and time formatting methods, such as and . - 主要的複合格式化方法，這是。The major composite formatting method, which is . - 其他複合格式化方法，例如和。Other composite formatting methods, such as and . 所有日期和時間格式設定作業進行都使用實作。All date and time formatting operations make use of an implementation. 介面會包含單一方法。The interface includes a single method, . 傳遞給這個回呼方法物件，表示提供格式設定資訊所需的型別。This callback method is passed a object that represents the type needed to provide formatting information. 方法會傳回該類型的執行個體或`null`如果它無法提供類型的執行個體。The method returns either an instance of that type or `null` if it cannot provide an instance of the type. .NET Framework 包含兩個格式化日期和時間的實作：The .NET Framework includes two implementations for formatting dates and times: - 類別，其代表特定文化特性 （或特定國家/地區中的特定語言）。The class, which represents a specific culture (or a specific language in a specific country/region). 在日期和時間格式化作業中，方法會傳回相關聯的物件及其屬性。In a date and time formatting operation, the method returns the object associated with its property. - 類別，可提供其相關聯的文化特性的格式化慣例相關資訊。The class, which provides information about the formatting conventions of its associated culture. 方法會傳回本身的執行個體。The method returns an instance of itself. 如果實作未提供格式化方法來明確地所傳回的物件使用代表目前執行緒文化特性的屬性。If an implementation is not provided to a formatting method explicitly, the object returned by the property that represents the current thread culture is used. 下列範例說明之間的關聯性介面和在格式化作業中的類別。The following example illustrates the relationship between the interface and the class in formatting operations. 它會定義自訂實作其方法會顯示在格式化作業所要求的物件型別。It defines a custom implementation whose method displays the type of the object requested by the formatting operation. 如果它要求物件，此方法提供目前執行緒文化特性的物件。If it is requesting a object, the method provides the object for the current thread culture. 做為範例所示，從輸出方法要求物件，提供格式設定資訊，而方法要求並物件以及實作。As the output from the example shows, the method requests a object to provide formatting information, whereas the method requests and objects as well as an implementation. (請參閱[DateTimeFormatInfo 物件具現化](#instantiating)一節。)(See the [Instantiating a DateTimeFormatInfo object](#instantiating) section.) 2. 修改或多個用來產生所要的結果字串的屬性。Modify the property or properties that are used to produce the desired result string. (如需有關如何格式化方法使用資訊屬性來定義結果字串，請參閱上一節[格式字串和 DateTimeFormatInfo 屬性](#format-strings-and-datetimeformatinfo-properties)。)(For information about how formatting methods use properties to define result strings, see the previous section, [Format strings and DateTimeFormatInfo properties](#format-strings-and-datetimeformatinfo-properties).) 3. 使用自訂物件建立為您格式化方法的呼叫中引數。Use the custom object you created as the argument in calls to formatting methods. 有兩種方式可變更的結果字串的格式：There are two other ways to change the format of a result string: - 您可以使用類別來定義自訂的文化特性 （文化特性的文化特性具有唯一的名稱，且以補充現有的） 或取代的文化特性 （一個是用來取代特定的文化特性）。You can use the class to define either a custom culture (a culture that has a unique name and that supplements existing cultures) or a replacement culture (one that is used instead of a specific culture). 您可以儲存，並以程式設計方式存取此文化特性，如同任何.NET Framework 所支援的物件。You can save and access this culture programmatically as you would any object supported by the .NET Framework. - 如果結果字串不區分文化特性，而不是採用預先定義的格式，您可以使用的自訂日期和時間格式字串。If the result string is not culture-sensitive and doesn't follow a predefined format, you can use a custom date and time format string. 例如，如果您要序列化 YYYYMMDDHHmmss 格式的日期和時間資料，您可以產生結果字串傳遞至自訂格式字串方法，而且您可以將結果字串的轉換回藉由呼叫的值方法。For example, if you are serializing date and time data in the format YYYYMMDDHHmmss, you can generate the result string by passing the custom format string to the method, and you can convert the result string back to a value by calling the method. ### 變更的簡短日期模式Changing the short date pattern 下列範例會變更"d"（簡短日期） 標準格式字串所產生的結果字串的格式。The following example changes the format of a result string produced by the "d" (short date) standard format string. 它會變更相關聯EN-US 或英文 （美國） 文化特性，從"yyyy/m / 」 至其預設值的屬性"yyyy'-"MM"-"dd"和"d"標準格式字串來顯示日期之前和之後的使用屬性變更。It changes the associated property for the en-US or English (United States) culture from its default of "M/d/yyyy" to "yyyy'-"MM"-"dd" and uses the "d" standard format string to display the date both before and after the property is changed. [!code-csharp[System.Globalization.DateTimeFormatInfo.Class#13](~/samples/snippets/csharp/VS_Snippets_CLR_System/system.globalization.datetimeformatinfo.class/cs/example2.cs#13)] [!code-vb[System.Globalization.DateTimeFormatInfo.Class#13](~/samples/snippets/visualbasic/VS_Snippets_CLR_System/system.globalization.datetimeformatinfo.class/vb/example2.vb#13)] 一般情況下，若要變更屬性也會影響屬性，依序定義的"F"標準格式字串所傳回的結果字串。Ordinarily, the change to the property also affects the property, which in turn defines the result string returned by the "F" standard format string. 若要保留原始的完整日期和時間模式，範例會重新指派原始的自訂格式字串指派給屬性之後屬性修改。To preserve the original full date and time pattern, the example reassigns the original custom format string assigned to the property after the property is modified. ### 從 12 小時制時鐘變更為 24 小時制時鐘Changing from a 12-hour clock to a 24-hour clock 對於許多.NET Framework 中的文化特性，會使用 12 小時制時鐘和 AM/PM 指示項表示的時間。For many cultures in the .NET Framework, the time is expressed by using a 12-hour clock and an AM/PM designator. 下列範例會定義`ReplaceWith24HourClock`方法會取代任何使用 24 小時制的格式會使用 12 小時制的時間格式。The following example defines a `ReplaceWith24HourClock` method that replaces any time format that uses a 12-hour clock with a format that uses a 24-hour clock. (?(openAMPM) h+(?[^ht]+)$ | \s*h+(?[^ht]+)\s*t+)` is defined as follows: |模式Pattern|描述Description| |-------------|-----------------| |`^`|從字串的開頭開始比對。Begin the match at the beginning of the string.| |`(?\s*t+\s*)?`|比對零或一次出現零或多個空格字元，後面接著字母"t"，其中一或多次，後面接著零或多個空格字元。Match zero or one occurrence of zero or more white-space characters, followed by the letter "t" one or more times, followed by zero or more white-space characters. 此擷取群組會命名為`openAMPM`。This capturing group is named `openAMPM`.| |`(?(openAMPM) h+(?[^ht]+)$`|如果`openAMPM`群組有相符項目，比對字母"h"一或多次，後面接著一或多個非"h"或"t"的字元。If the `openAMPM` group has a match, match the letter "h" one or more times, followed by one or more characters that are neither "h" nor "t". 比對結束的字串結尾。The match ends at the end of the string. 擷取名為擷取群組中包含"h"之後的所有字元`nonHours`。All characters captured after "h" are included in a capturing group named `nonHours`.| |`| \s*h+(?[^ht]+)\s*t+)`|如果`openAMPM`群組並沒有相符項目，比對字母"h"一或多次，後面接著一或多個非"h"或"t"、 字元後面接著零或多個空格字元。If the `openAMPM` group does not have a match, match the letter "h" one or more times, followed by one or more characters that are neither "h" nor "t", followed by zero or more white-space characters. 最後，符合一或多個出現字母"t"。Finally, match one or more occurrences of the letter "t". "H"與之前的泛空白字元和"t"包含在名為擷取群組所擷取的所有字元`nonHours`。All characters captured after "h" and before the white-spaces and "t" are included in a capturing group named `nonHours`.| `nonHours`擷取群組包含分鐘和可能的第二個元件的自訂日期和時間格式字串，以及任何時間分隔符號的符號。The `nonHours` capturing group contains the minute and possibly the second component of a custom date and time format string, along with any time separator symbols. 取代模式`HH${nonHours}`前面加上這些元素的子字串"HH"。The replacement pattern `HH${nonHours}` prepends the substring "HH" to these elements. ### 顯示和變更的日期中的紀元Displaying and changing the era in a date 下列範例會將"g"自訂格式規範來屬性的物件，表示 EN-US 文化特性的格式化慣例。The following example adds the "g" custom format specifier to the property of an object that represents the formatting conventions of the en-US culture. 此新增會影響下列三種標準格式字串：This addition affects the following three standard format strings: - "D"(long date) 的標準格式字串，會直接對應到屬性。The "D" (long date) standard format string, which maps directly to the property. - "f"(完整日期簡短時間 /) 產生的結果字串會串連所產生的子字串的標準格式字串和屬性。The "f" (full date / short time) standard format string, which produces a result string that concatenates the substrings produced by the and properties. - "F"(完整日期完整時間 /) 標準格式字串，會直接對應到屬性。The "F" (full date / long time) standard format string, which maps directly to the property. 因為我們沒有明確設定此屬性值，它會動態產生的串連和屬性。Because we have not explicitly set this property value, it is generated dynamically by concatenating the and properties. 此範例也示範如何變更其行事曆當中有單一紀元的文化特性的紀元名稱。The example also shows how to change the era name for a culture whose calendar has a single era. 在此情況下，EN-US 文化特性會使用西曆，由物件。In this case, the en-US culture uses the Gregorian calendar, which is represented by a object. 類別支援單一紀元，其名稱 A.D.The class supports a single era, which it names A.D. (P.m)。(Anno Domini). 此範例的紀元名稱變更為西元The example changes the era name to C.E. （中古時代） 取代指派給格式字串中的"g"自訂格式規範屬性與一個常值的字串。(Common Era) by replacing the "g" custom format specifier in the format string assigned to the property with a literal string. 使用常值字串是有必要，因為紀元名稱通常由方法從.NET Framework 或 Windows 作業系統所提供的文化特性資料表中的私用資料。The use of a literal string is necessary, because the era name is typically returned by the method from private data in the culture tables supplied by either the .NET Framework or the Windows operating system. [!code-csharp[System.Globalization.DateTimeFormatInfo.Class#11](~/samples/snippets/csharp/VS_Snippets_CLR_System/system.globalization.datetimeformatinfo.class/cs/example4.cs#11)] [!code-vb[System.Globalization.DateTimeFormatInfo.Class#11](~/samples/snippets/visualbasic/VS_Snippets_CLR_System/system.globalization.datetimeformatinfo.class/vb/example4.vb#11)] ## 剖析日期和時間字串Parsing date and time strings 剖析是指將轉換的日期和時間的字串表示或值。Parsing involves converting the string representation of a date and time to a or value. 這兩種類型包括`Parse`， `TryParse`， `ParseExact`，和`TryParseExact`方法，以支援剖析作業。Both of these types include the `Parse`, `TryParse`, `ParseExact`, and `TryParseExact` methods to support parsing operations. `Parse`並`TryParse`方法會將字串轉換可以有各種不同的格式，而`ParseExact`和`TryParseExact`需要字串具有已定義的格式。The `Parse` and `TryParse` methods convert a string that can have a variety of formats, whereas `ParseExact` and `TryParseExact` require that the string have a defined format or formats. 如果剖析作業失敗，`Parse`並`ParseExact`擲回的例外狀況，而`TryParse`並`TryParseExact`傳回`false`。If the parsing operation fails, `Parse` and `ParseExact` throw an exception, whereas `TryParse` and `TryParseExact` return `false`. 剖析方法會以隱含或明確使用列舉值，以判斷哪一個 （例如前置、 尾端，或內部空白字元） 的樣式項目中會有要剖析的字串，以及如何解譯剖析的字串或任何遺漏項目。The parsing methods implicitly or explicitly use a enumeration value to determine which style elements (such as leading, trailing, or inner white space) can be present in the string to be parsed, and how to interpret the parsed string or any missing elements. 如果您未提供值，當您呼叫`Parse`或`TryParse`方法，預設值是，這是包含複合樣式， ，和旗標。If you don't provide a value when you call the `Parse` or `TryParse` method, the default is , which is a composite style that includes the , , and flags. 針對`ParseExact`並`TryParseExact`方法，預設值是; 輸入的字串必須精確地為特定自訂日期和時間格式字串對應。For the `ParseExact` and `TryParseExact` methods, the default is ; the input string must correspond precisely to a particular custom date and time format string. 剖析方法也會隱含地或明確地使用物件，定義特定符號和模式可能會發生在要剖析的字串。The parsing methods also implicitly or explicitly use a object that defines the specific symbols and patterns that can occur in the string to be parsed. 如果您未提供物件，物件預設會使用目前執行緒文化特性。If you don't provide a object, the object for the current thread culture is used by default. 如需剖析日期和時間字串的詳細資訊，請參閱個別的剖析方法，例如， ， ，和。For more information about parsing date and time strings, see the individual parsing methods, such as , , , and . 下列範例說明剖析的日期和時間字串的區分文化特性的本質。The following example illustrates the culture-sensitive nature of parsing date and time strings. 它會嘗試使用來剖析兩個日期字串 EN-US、 EN-GB、 FR-FR 和 FI-FI 文化特性的慣例。It tries to parse two date strings by using the conventions of the en-US, en-GB, fr-FR, and fi-FI cultures. 日期，會解譯為 8/18/2014 en-us 文化特性會擲回中其他三個例外狀況文化特性，因為 18 會解譯為月數。The date that is interpreted as 8/18/2014 in the en-US culture throws a exception in the other three cultures because 18 is interpreted as the month number. 2015 年 1 月 2 日會剖析為 EN-US 文化特性的第一個月的第二天而其餘的文化特性的第二個月的第一天。1/2/2015 is parsed as the second day of the first month in the en-US culture, but as the first day of the second month in the remaining cultures. [!code-csharp[System.Globalization.DateTimeFormatInfo.Class#15](~/samples/snippets/csharp/VS_Snippets_CLR_System/system.globalization.datetimeformatinfo.class/cs/parsing1.cs#15)] [!code-vb[System.Globalization.DateTimeFormatInfo.Class#15](~/samples/snippets/visualbasic/VS_Snippets_CLR_System/system.globalization.datetimeformatinfo.class/vb/parsing1.vb#15)] 通常原因有兩個剖析日期和時間的字串：Date and time strings are typically parsed for two reasons: - 若要將使用者輸入轉換成日期和時間值。To convert user input into a date and time value. - 若要反覆存取日期和時間值;也就是要還原序列化日期和時間值，這個值之前已序列化為字串。To round-trip a date and time value; that is, to deserialize a date and time value that was previously serialized as a string. 下列各節將討論這兩項作業中有更詳細。The following sections discuss these two operations in greater detail. ### 剖析使用者字串Parsing user strings 當您剖析使用者輸入的日期和時間字串時，您應該一律具現化反映使用者的文化特性設定，包括使用者所做的任何自訂的物件。When you parse date and time strings input by the user, you should always instantiate a object that reflects the user's cultural settings, including any customizations the user may have made. 否則，日期和時間的物件可能有不正確的值。Otherwise, the date and time object may have incorrect values. 如需如何具現化物件，以反映使用者文化特性的自訂設定，請參閱[DateTimeFormatInfo 和動態資料](#dynamic)一節。For information about how to instantiate a object that reflects user cultural customizations, see the [DateTimeFormatInfo and dynamic data](#dynamic) section. 下列範例說明剖析作業中，以反映使用者的文化設定及未之間的差異。The following example illustrates the difference between a parsing operation that reflects user cultural settings and one that does not. 在此案例中，預設系統文化特性是 EN-US，但使用者已使用控制台中**地區和語言**簡短日期模式從預設的"m/yyyy"變更"yy/MM/dd"。In this case, the default system culture is en-US, but the user has used Control Panel, **Region and Language** to change the short date pattern from its default of "M/d/yyyy" to "yy/MM/dd". 當使用者輸入字串會反映使用者設定，且所剖析的字串物件，也會反映使用者設定 （覆寫），在剖析作業會傳回正確的結果。When the user enters a string that reflects user settings, and the string is parsed by a object that also reflects user settings (overrides), the parsing operation returns a correct result. 不過，當字串會剖析物件，以反映標準 EN-US 文化特性設定，則剖析方法會擲回例外狀況因為它可解譯 14 的月數不年份的後兩位數。However, when the string is parsed by a object that reflects standard en-US cultural settings, the parsing method throws a exception because it interprets 14 as the number of the month, not the last two digits of the year. [!code-csharp[System.Globalization.DateTimeFormatInfo.Class#16](~/samples/snippets/csharp/VS_Snippets_CLR_System/system.globalization.datetimeformatinfo.class/cs/parse2.cs#16)] [!code-vb[System.Globalization.DateTimeFormatInfo.Class#16](~/samples/snippets/visualbasic/VS_Snippets_CLR_System/system.globalization.datetimeformatinfo.class/vb/parse2.vb#16)] ### 序列化和還原序列化日期和時間資料Serializing and deserializing date and time data 序列化日期和時間資料會反覆存取;也就是所有序列化和還原序列化的值應該相同。Serialized date and time data are expected to round-trip; that is, all serialized and deserialized values should be identical. 如果日期和時間值代表單一時間點，還原序列化的值應該代表不論文化特性或其已還原的系統時區的時間相同時間點。If a date and time value represents a single moment in time, the deserialized value should represent the same moment in time regardless of the culture or time zone of the system on which it was restored. 若要反覆存取日期和時間資料成功，您必須使用所傳回的非變異文化特性的慣例屬性，以產生和剖析資料。To round-trip date and time data successfully, you must use the conventions of the invariant culture, which is returned by the property, to generate and parse the data. 「 格式化和剖析作業應該不會反映出預設文化特性的慣例。The formatting and parsing operations should never reflect the conventions of the default culture. 如果您使用預設文化特性設定，可攜性的資料會嚴格限制;它可以成功還原序列化，只有在執行緒，其文化特性特有的設定是完全相同的執行緒在其序列化。If you use default cultural settings, the portability of the data is strictly limited; it can be successfully deserialized only on a thread whose cultural-specific settings are identical to those of the thread on which it was serialized. 在某些情況下，這表示，資料無法即使已成功序列化和還原序列化的同一個系統。In some cases, this means that the data cannot even be successfully serialized and deserialized on the same system. 如果很長的時間元件的日期和時間值，應該也轉換成 UTC 並使用"o"或"r"序列化[標準格式字串](~/docs/standard/base-types/standard-date-and-time-format-strings.md)。If the time component of a date and time value is significant, it should also be converted to UTC and serialized by using the "o" or "r" [standard format string](~/docs/standard/base-types/standard-date-and-time-format-strings.md). 然後可以藉由呼叫剖析方法，並將其傳遞適當的格式字串而異的文化特性與還原時間資料`provider`引數。The time data can then be restored by calling a parsing method and passing it the appropriate format string along with the invariant culture as the `provider` argument. 下列範例說明如何反覆存取日期和時間值的程序。The following example illustrates the process of round-tripping a date and time value. 它會序列化的日期和時間的系統上，觀察到美國太平洋時間，且目前文化特性為 EN-US。It serializes a date and time on a system that observes U.S. Pacific time and whose current culture is en-US. [!code-csharp[System.Globalization.DateTimeFormatInfo.Class#17](~/samples/snippets/csharp/VS_Snippets_CLR_System/system.globalization.datetimeformatinfo.class/cs/serialize1.cs#17)] [!code-vb[System.Globalization.DateTimeFormatInfo.Class#17](~/samples/snippets/visualbasic/VS_Snippets_CLR_System/system.globalization.datetimeformatinfo.class/vb/serialize1.vb#17)] 還原序列化布魯塞爾，哥本哈根，馬德里，巴黎時區系統上的資料和目前文化特性為 fr-fr。It deserializes the data on a system in the Brussels, Copenhagen, Madrid and Paris time zone and whose current culture is fr-FR. 還原的日期是 9 個小時的原始日期，會反映從晚 UTC 八小時時區調整 UTC 快一個小時的時間晚。The restored date is nine hours later than the original date, which reflects the time zone adjustment from eight hours behind UTC to one hour ahead of UTC. 原始的日期和還原的日期表示相同時間點。Both the original date and the restored date represent the same moment in time. [!code-csharp[System.Globalization.DateTimeFormatInfo.Class#18](~/samples/snippets/csharp/VS_Snippets_CLR_System/system.globalization.datetimeformatinfo.class/cs/serialize2.cs#18)] [!code-vb[System.Globalization.DateTimeFormatInfo.Class#18](~/samples/snippets/visualbasic/VS_Snippets_CLR_System/system.globalization.datetimeformatinfo.class/vb/serialize2.vb#18)] ## Examples 下列範例會使用反映來取得的屬性英文 （美國） 文化特性的物件。The following example uses reflection to get the properties of the object for the English (United States) culture. 它會顯示包含自訂格式字串的那些屬性的值，並使用這些字串來顯示格式的日期。It displays the value of those properties that contain custom format strings and uses those strings to display formatted dates. [!code-csharp[System.Globalization.DateTimeFormatInfo.Class#5](~/samples/snippets/csharp/VS_Snippets_CLR_System/system.globalization.datetimeformatinfo.class/cs/format1.cs#5)] [!code-vb[System.Globalization.DateTimeFormatInfo.Class#5](~/samples/snippets/visualbasic/VS_Snippets_CLR_System/system.globalization.datetimeformatinfo.class/vb/format1.vb#5)]

remarks.format: ## Remarks 這個建構函式會建立物件，表示文化特性而異的日期和時間資訊。This constructor creates a object that represents the date and time information of the invariant culture. 若要建立物件的特定文化特性，建立用於該文化特性物件，並擷取所傳回的物件及其屬性。To create a object for a specific culture, create a object for that culture and retrieve the object returned by its property. 屬性可以修改這個建構函式所建立的物件。The properties of the object created by this constructor can be modified. 不過，您無法修改屬性，因為文化特性而異支援西曆的當地語系化的版本。However, you cannot modify the property, because the invariant culture supports only a localized version of the Gregorian calendar. 若要建立物件，使用特定的行事曆，您必須具現化物件，該物件支援行事曆，並將指派的行事曆屬性所傳回的物件屬性.To create a object that uses a specific calendar, you must instantiate a object that supports that calendar and assign the calendar to the property of the object returned by the property.

remarks.format: ## Remarks 如果設定此屬性，陣列必須是一維陣列，而且必須完全七個元素。If setting this property, the array must be one-dimensional and must have exactly seven elements. 第一個項目 （項目索引位置為零） 表示中所定義的行事曆週的第一天屬性。The first element (the element at index zero) represents the first day of the week in the calendar defined by the property. 自訂格式字串"ddd"格式規範，如果或是方法包含的適當成員取代"ddd"的結果字串中的陣列。If a custom format string includes the "ddd" format specifier, the or method includes the appropriate member of the array in place of the "ddd" in the result string. 如果這個屬性會受影響的值屬性變更。This property is affected if the value of the property changes. 如果所選不支援縮寫星期幾名稱，則陣列包含完整的日期名稱。If the selected does not support abbreviated day names, the array contains the full day names. ## Examples 下列範例會建立讀取/寫入物件，代表 英文 （美國） 文化特性，並將指派縮寫的星期名稱來其屬性。The following example creates a read/write object that represents the English (United States) culture and assigns abbreviated day names to its property. 然後，它使用中的"ddd"格式規範[自訂日期和時間格式字串](~/docs/standard/base-types/custom-date-and-time-format-strings.md)来顯示的一週的時間，從 2014 5 月 28 日的日期的字串表示。It then uses the "ddd" format specifier in a [custom date and time format string](~/docs/standard/base-types/custom-date-and-time-format-strings.md) to display the string representation of dates for one week beginning May 28, 2014. remarks.format: ## Remarks 在某些語言中，屬於日期的月份名稱會出現在所有格。In some languages, a month name that is part of a date appears in the genitive case. 比方說，RU-RU 或俄文 （俄羅斯） 文化特性的日期所組成的日數和所有格的月份名稱，例如 1 Января （1 年 1 月）。For example, a date in the ru-RU or Russian (Russia) culture consists of the day number and the genitive month name, such as 1 Января (1 January). 對於這些文化特性，自訂格式字串"MMM"格式規範，如果或是方法包含的適當成員取代"MMM"的結果字串中的陣列。For these cultures, if a custom format string includes the "MMM" format specifier, the or method includes the appropriate member of the array in place of the "MMM" in the result string. 在設定作業中，此陣列必須是一維完全 13 項目時，因為物件符合有 13 個月的行事曆。In a set operation, the array must be one-dimensional with exactly 13 elements, because objects accommodate calendars that have 13 months. 第十三個元素應該是具有 12 個月的行事曆， 。For calendars that have 12 months, the thirteenth element should be . （索引零處的項目） 的第一個項目代表一年所定義的第一個月屬性。The first element (the element at index zero) represents the first month of the year defined by the property. 如果您設定屬性，您也必須設定屬性。If you set the property, you must also set the property. ## Examples 下列範例會建立讀取/寫入物件，代表 英文 （美國） 文化特性，並將指派縮寫所有格的月份名稱及其和屬性。The following example creates a read/write object that represents the English (United States) culture and assigns abbreviated genitive month names to its and properties. 然後，它會顯示包含每個月的縮寫的月份名稱的文化特性支援行事曆中的日期的字串表示。It then displays the string representation of dates that include the abbreviated month name of each month in the culture's supported calendar. [!code-csharp[System.Globalization.DateTimeFormatInfo.AbbreviatedMonthGenitiveNames#1](~/samples/snippets/csharp/VS_Snippets_CLR_System/system.globalization.datetimeformatinfo.abbreviatedmonthgenitivenames/cs/abbreviatedmonthnames1.cs#1)] [!code-vb[System.Globalization.DateTimeFormatInfo.AbbreviatedMonthGenitiveNames#1](~/samples/snippets/visualbasic/VS_Snippets_CLR_System/system.globalization.datetimeformatinfo.abbreviatedmonthgenitivenames/vb/abbreviatedmonthnames1.vb#1)]

remarks.format: ## Remarks 複製為可寫入即使原始物件是唯讀的。The clone is writable even if the original object is read-only. 因此，可修改複製品的屬性，利用使用者定義的模式。Therefore, the properties of the clone can be modified with user-defined patterns. 物件的淺層複本是物件的一份只有。A shallow copy of an object is a copy of the object only. 如果物件包含其他物件的參考，則淺層複製不會建立參考物件的複本。If the object contains references to other objects, the shallow copy does not create copies of the referred objects. 它改為參考原始物件。It refers to the original objects instead. 相較之下，物件的深層複本建立一份物件和一份直接或間接參考該物件的所有項目。In contrast, a deep copy of an object creates a copy of the object and a copy of everything directly or indirectly referenced by that object.

remarks.format: ## Remarks 這個方法會傳回陣列，其中包含所有對應至標準格式字串的自訂格式字串。This method returns an array that contains all custom format strings that correspond to standard format strings. 請參閱[標準日期和時間格式字串](~/docs/standard/base-types/standard-date-and-time-format-strings.md)取得一份標準格式字串。See [Standard Date and Time Format Strings](~/docs/standard/base-types/standard-date-and-time-format-strings.md) for a list of the standard format strings. 您可以使用自訂格式字串中所傳回的陣列在格式化作業中的方法。You can use the custom format strings in the array returned by the method in formatting operations. 不過，如果您這樣做，日期和時間值的字串表示傳回，格式化作業無法永遠剖析成功`Parse`和`TryParse`方法。However, if you do, the string representation of a date and time value returned in that formatting operation cannot always be parsed successfully by the `Parse` and `TryParse` methods. 因此，您不能假設所傳回的自訂格式字串方法可用來反覆存取日期和時間值。Therefore, you cannot assume that the custom format strings returned by the method can be used to round-trip date and time values. 下列範例說明此問題。The following example illustrates this problem. 它會擷取包含義大利 （義大利文） 文化特性格式資訊的物件。It retrieves a object that contains formatting information for the Italy (Italian) culture. 它會傳遞所傳回的陣列的每個自訂格式字串方法，以方法用來建立日期和時間的字串表示。It passes each custom format string in the array returned by the method to the method to create the string representation of a date and time. 此範例接著會嘗試將此值剖析藉由呼叫方法。This example then attempts to parse this value by calling the method. 如範例輸出所示，部分的自訂格式字串不會產生日期和時間值也會成功反覆存取。As the output from the example shows, some of the custom format strings do not produce a date and time value that successfully round-trips. [!code-csharp[System.Globalization.DateTimeFormatInfo.GetAllDateTimePatterns#1](~/samples/snippets/csharp/VS_Snippets_CLR_System/system.globalization.datetimeformatinfo.getalldatetimepatterns/cs/getalldatetimepatternsex1.cs#1)] [!code-vb[System.Globalization.DateTimeFormatInfo.GetAllDateTimePatterns#1](~/samples/snippets/visualbasic/VS_Snippets_CLR_System/system.globalization.datetimeformatinfo.getalldatetimepatterns/vb/getalldatetimepatternsex1.vb#1)] 若要剖析的日期和時間，可以表示幾種預先定義的自訂格式的字串表示，呼叫下列方法之一：To parse the string representation of a date and time that can be expressed in a number of predefined custom formats, call one of the following methods: - - - - 所傳回的陣列中的自訂格式字串方法而定，文化特性的現行曆法物件可提供格式設定資訊。The custom format strings in the array returned by the method depends on the current calendar of the culture for which the object supplies formatting information. 如果變更行事曆，這個方法所傳回的陣列也會變更。If the calendar changes, the array returned by this method also changes. ## Examples 下列範例會顯示日期和時間格式字串，而異的文化特性，以及產生時，格式字串用來設定特定日期的格式的結果字串。The following example displays the date and time format strings for the invariant culture, as well as the result string that is produced when that format string is used to format a particular date. span.span: The custom format string for a long date value.

remarks.format: ## Remarks 屬性會定義特定文化特性格式的呼叫所傳回的日期字串和方法和複合格式字串時，會提供"D"標準格式字串。The property defines the culture-specific format of date strings that are returned by calls to the and methods and by composite format strings that are supplied the "D" standard format string. 下列範例將說明下列之間的關聯性:"D"標準格式字串中，自訂格式字串所傳回屬性和特定文化特性的日期表示。The following example illustrates the relationships among the following: the "D" standard format string, the custom format string returned by the property, and the culture-specific representation of a date. [!code-csharp[System.Globalization.DateTimeFormatInfo.LongDatePattern#2](~/samples/snippets/csharp/VS_Snippets_CLR_System/system.Globalization.DateTimeFormatInfo.LongDatePattern/CS/longdatepattern1.cs#2)] [!code-vb[System.Globalization.DateTimeFormatInfo.LongDatePattern#2](~/samples/snippets/visualbasic/VS_Snippets_CLR_System/system.Globalization.DateTimeFormatInfo.LongDatePattern/VB/longdatepattern1.vb#2)] 請參閱[自訂日期和時間格式字串](~/docs/standard/base-types/custom-date-and-time-format-strings.md)針對個別的自訂格式規範，可以合併以建構例如"dddd，dd MMMM yyyy"自訂格式字串。See [Custom Date and Time Format Strings](~/docs/standard/base-types/custom-date-and-time-format-strings.md) for individual custom format specifiers that can be combined to construct custom format strings such as "dddd, dd MMMM yyyy". 您應該完全相符的字串，而不是使用日期分隔符號預留位置的完整日期模式設定的日期分隔符號。You should set the date separator in the long date pattern to an exact string instead of using the date separator placeholder. 例如，若要取得模式 MM DD yyyy，設定完整日期模式為 「 MM-DD-yyyy"。For example, to obtain the pattern MM-DD-yyyy, set the long date pattern to "MM-DD-yyyy". 如果文化特性變更所使用的行事曆，可能會變更這個屬性的值。The value of this property may change if the calendar used by a culture changes. 比方說，下列範例示範如何的屬性代表阿拉伯文 （敘利亞） 文化特性物件時變更文化特性變更所使用的物件。For instance, the following example shows how the property of a object that represents the Arabic (Syria) culture changes when the object used by the culture changes. [!code-csharp[System.Globalization.DateTimeFormatInfo.LongDatePattern#3](~/samples/snippets/csharp/VS_Snippets_CLR_System/system.Globalization.DateTimeFormatInfo.LongDatePattern/CS/longdatepattern2.cs#3)] [!code-vb[System.Globalization.DateTimeFormatInfo.LongDatePattern#3](~/samples/snippets/visualbasic/VS_Snippets_CLR_System/system.Globalization.DateTimeFormatInfo.LongDatePattern/VB/longdatepattern2.vb#3)] ## Examples 下列範例顯示的值少數的文化特性的屬性。The following example displays the value of the property for a few cultures. [!code-cpp[System.Globalization.DateTimeFormatInfo.LongDatePattern#1](~/samples/snippets/cpp/VS_Snippets_CLR_System/system.Globalization.DateTimeFormatInfo.LongDatePattern/CPP/dtfi_longdatepattern.cpp#1)] [!code-csharp[System.Globalization.DateTimeFormatInfo.LongDatePattern#1](~/samples/snippets/csharp/VS_Snippets_CLR_System/system.Globalization.DateTimeFormatInfo.LongDatePattern/CS/dtfi_longdatepattern.cs#1)] [!code-vb[System.Globalization.DateTimeFormatInfo.LongDatePattern#1](~/samples/snippets/visualbasic/VS_Snippets_CLR_System/system.Globalization.DateTimeFormatInfo.LongDatePattern/VB/dtfi_longdatepattern.vb#1)]

remarks.format: ## Remarks 屬性會定義特定文化特性格式的呼叫所傳回的日期字串和方法和複合格式字串時，會提供"m"和"M"標準格式字串。The property defines the culture-specific format of date strings that are returned by calls to the and methods and by composite format strings that are supplied the "m" and "M" standard format strings. 如果這個屬性會受影響的值屬性變更。This property is affected if the value of the property changes. 我們建議您設定的日期分隔符號，完全相符的字串，而不是使用日期分隔符號預留位置的月份和日期模式。We recommend that you set the date separator in the month and day pattern to an exact string instead of using the date separator placeholder. 例如，若要取得 YYYY-MM-DD 的模式，設定月份和日期模式，以"YYYY-MM-DD"。For example, to obtain the pattern MM-DD, set the month and day pattern to "MM-DD". ## Examples 下列範例顯示的值少數的文化特性。The following example displays the value of for a few cultures. [!code-cpp[System.Globalization.DateTimeFormatInfo.MonthDayPattern#1](~/samples/snippets/cpp/VS_Snippets_CLR_System/system.Globalization.DateTimeFormatInfo.MonthDayPattern/CPP/dtfi_monthdaypattern.cpp#1)] [!code-csharp[System.Globalization.DateTimeFormatInfo.MonthDayPattern#1](~/samples/snippets/csharp/VS_Snippets_CLR_System/system.Globalization.DateTimeFormatInfo.MonthDayPattern/CS/dtfi_monthdaypattern.cs#1)] [!code-vb[System.Globalization.DateTimeFormatInfo.MonthDayPattern#1](~/samples/snippets/visualbasic/VS_Snippets_CLR_System/system.Globalization.DateTimeFormatInfo.MonthDayPattern/VB/dtfi_monthdaypattern.vb#1)]

remarks.format: ## Remarks 在某些語言中，屬於日期的月份名稱會出現在所有格。In some languages, a month name that is part of a date appears in the genitive case. 例如，"RU-RU"的俄文 （俄羅斯） 的日期，文化特性所組成的日數和所有格的月份名稱，例如 1 Января。For example, a date in the Russian (Russia) or "ru-RU", culture consists of the day number and the genitive month name, such as 1 Января. 當設定這個屬性時，陣列必須是一維陣列，而且必須剛好為 13 個元素。When this property is set, the array must be one-dimensional and must have exactly 13 elements. 物件符合使用 13 個月的行事曆。 objects accommodate calendars with 13 months. （索引零處的項目） 的第一個項目代表一年所定義的第一個月屬性。如果您設定屬性，您也必須設定屬性。The first element (the element at index zero) represents the first month of the year defined by the property.If you set the property, you must also set the property. ## Examples 下列範例會示範幾個方法和屬性，以指定日期和時間格式模式、 原生行事曆名稱和完整和縮寫的月份和星期名稱。The following example demonstrates several methods and properties that specify date and time format patterns, native calendar name, and full and abbreviated month and day names. summary.span: 取得或設定 "post meridiem" (正午以後) 小時的字串指示項。

span.span: Gets or sets the string designator for hours that are "post meridiem" (after noon).

span.span: The string designator for hours that are "post meridiem" (after noon).

value.span: 的預設值為 "PM"。

span.span: The default for is "PM".

remarks.format: ## Remarks 屬性用於所有的時間從 12:00:00 （中午） 到 23:59:59.999。The property is used for all times from 12:00:00 (noon) to 23:59:59.999. 如果自訂模式包含格式模式"tt"，而且時間是在中午顯示的值取代"tt"的格式模式中。If the custom pattern includes the format pattern "tt" and the time is after noon, displays the value of in place of the "tt" in the format pattern. 如果自訂模式包含格式模式"t"，只有第一個字元隨即出現。If the custom pattern includes the format pattern "t", only the first character of is displayed. 您的應用程式應該使用"tt"的語言，是為了維護 AM 和 PM 之間的差異。Your application should use "tt" for languages for which it is necessary to maintain the distinction between AM and PM. 其中一種就是日文，日文的 AM 和 PM 指示項的第二個字元 (非第一個字元) 不同。An example is Japanese, for which the AM and PM designators differ in the second character instead of the first character. 對於不使用 PM 指示項的文化特性，這個屬性會傳回空字串。For cultures that do not use a PM designator, this property returns an empty string.

summary.span: 取得時間值的自訂格式字串，這個字串是根據網際網路工程任務推動小組 (Internet Engineering Task Force，IETF) 要求建議 (RFC) 1123 規格。

span.span: Gets the custom format string for a time value that is based on the Internet Engineering Task Force (IETF) Request for Comments (RFC) 1123 specification.

value.span: 根據 IETF RFC 1123 規格的時間值的自訂格式字串。

span.span: The custom format string for a time value that is based on the IETF RFC 1123 specification.

remarks.format: ## Remarks 屬性會定義特定文化特性格式的呼叫所傳回的日期字串和方法和複合格式字串時，會提供"r"和"R"標準格式字串。The property defines the culture-specific format of date strings that are returned by calls to the and methods and by composite format strings that are supplied the "r" and "R" standard format strings. RFC1123 模式反映已定義的標準，且屬性為唯讀。The RFC1123 pattern reflects a defined standard, and the property is read-only. 因此，它一律為相同，不論文化特性為何。Therefore, it is always the same, regardless of the culture. 自訂格式字串為 "ddd, dd MMM yyyy HH':'mm':'ss 'GMT'"。The custom format string is "ddd, dd MMM yyyy HH':'mm':'ss 'GMT'". ## Examples 下列範例會顯示一些文化特性的 RFC1123Pattern 的值。The following example displays the value of RFC1123Pattern for a few cultures. [!code-cpp[System.Globalization.DateTimeFormatInfo.RFC1123Pattern#1](~/samples/snippets/cpp/VS_Snippets_CLR_System/system.Globalization.DateTimeFormatInfo.RFC1123Pattern/CPP/dtfi_rfc1123pattern.cpp#1)] [!code-csharp[System.Globalization.DateTimeFormatInfo.RFC1123Pattern#1](~/samples/snippets/csharp/VS_Snippets_CLR_System/system.Globalization.DateTimeFormatInfo.RFC1123Pattern/CS/dtfi_rfc1123pattern.cs#1)] [!code-vb[System.Globalization.DateTimeFormatInfo.RFC1123Pattern#1](~/samples/snippets/visualbasic/VS_Snippets_CLR_System/system.Globalization.DateTimeFormatInfo.RFC1123Pattern/VB/dtfi_rfc1123pattern.vb#1)]

span.span: An array of custom format strings.

param.name: format
param.span: 與 參數中所指定的自訂格式字串相關聯的標準格式字串。

span.span: The standard format string associated with the custom format strings specified in the parameter.

summary.span: 設定對應於指定之標準格式字串的自訂日期和時間格式字串。

span.span: Sets the custom date and time format strings that correspond to a specified standard format string.

remarks.format: ## Remarks 方法定義的自訂格式字串對應至特定標準日期和時間格式字串。The method defines the custom format strings that correspond to a particular standard date and time format string. 如果呼叫的日期和時間格式化方法包含的標準日期和時間格式字串所指定`format`，此方法會使用中的第一個項目`patterns`定義結果字串的格式陣列。If a call to a date and time formatting method includes the standard date and time format string specified by `format`, the method uses the first element in the `patterns` array to define the format of the resulting string. > [!WARNING] > `Parse`並`TryParse`方法不完全反覆運算中的所有字串`patterns`時剖析的日期和時間的字串表示。The `Parse` and `TryParse` methods do not fully iterate all strings in `patterns` when parsing the string representation of a date and time. 如果您需要的剖析作業中有特定格式的日期和時間的字串，您應該傳遞有效的格式，以陣列， ， ，或方法。If you require a date and time string to have particular formats in a parsing operation, you should pass the array of valid formats to the , , , or method. 您可以定義自訂格式字串對應至"d"、"D"、"t"、"T"、"y"或"Y"標準日期和時間格式字串。You can define custom format strings that correspond to the "d", "D", "t", "T", and "y" or "Y" standard date and time format strings. 如果值`format`是任何其他標準格式字串方法會擲回。If the value of `format` is any other standard format string, the method throws an . 如果您的自訂日期和時間格式字串包含日期分隔符號，您應該明確指定為日期分隔符號，而不是依賴"/"自訂格式規範取代特定的日期分隔符號剖析或格式化方法。If your custom date and time format strings include date separators, you should explicitly specify a date separator instead of relying on the parsing or formatting method that replaces the "/" custom format specifier with a particular date separator. 例如，若要取得模式 MM DD yyyy，使用模式為"MM-DD-yyyy"。For example, to obtain the pattern MM-DD-yyyy, use the pattern "MM-DD-yyyy". ## Examples 下列範例會具現化物件代表"EN-US"（英文-美國） 文化特性，並使用它來剖析日期和時間的字串，使用"Y"標準格式字串的陣列。The following example instantiates a object that represents the "en-US" (English - United States) culture and uses it to parse an array of date and time strings using the "Y" standard format string. 然後它會使用方法相關聯的新的自訂格式字串"Y"標準格式字串，然後嘗試剖析的日期和時間的字串陣列。It then uses the method to associate a new custom format string with the "Y" standard format string, and then attempts to parse the array of date and time strings. 範例輸出所示範的新的自訂格式字串，用於剖析和格式化作業。Output from the example demonstrates that the new custom format string is used in both the parsing and formatting operations. [!code-csharp[System.Globalization.DateTimeFormatInfo.SetAllDateTimePatterns#1](~/samples/snippets/csharp/VS_Snippets_CLR_System/system.globalization.datetimeformatinfo.setalldatetimepatterns/cs/setalldatetimepatterns.cs#1)] [!code-vb[System.Globalization.DateTimeFormatInfo.SetAllDateTimePatterns#1](~/samples/snippets/visualbasic/VS_Snippets_CLR_System/system.globalization.datetimeformatinfo.setalldatetimepatterns/vb/setalldatetimepatterns.vb#1)]

remarks.format: ## Remarks 屬性會定義特定文化特性格式的呼叫所傳回的日期字串和方法和複合格式字串時，會提供"t"標準格式字串。The property defines the culture-specific format of date strings that are returned by calls to the and methods and by composite format strings that are supplied the "t" standard format string. 我們建議您設定時間分隔符號，而不是使用時間分隔符號預留位置完全相符的字串的簡短時間模式。We recommend that you set the time separator in the short time pattern to an exact string instead of using the time separator placeholder. 例如，若要取得模式為 h-mm-ss，設定簡短時間模式，以"h-mm-ss"。For example, to obtain the pattern h-mm-ss, set the short time pattern to "h-mm-ss". ## Examples 下列範例顯示的值少數的文化特性。The following example displays the value of for a few cultures. value.span: 可排序日期和時間值的自訂格式字串。

remarks.format: ## Remarks 屬性會定義特定文化特性格式的呼叫所傳回的日期字串和方法和複合格式字串時，會提供"s"標準格式字串。The property defines the culture-specific format of date strings that are returned by calls to the and methods and by composite format strings that are supplied the "s" standard format string. 所傳回的格式字串屬性會反映已定義的標準 (ISO 8601)，且屬性為唯讀。The format string returned by the property reflects a defined standard (ISO 8601), and the property is read-only. 因此，它一律為相同，不論文化特性為何。Therefore, it is always the same, regardless of the culture. 自訂格式字串為 "yyyy'-'MM'-'dd'T'HH':'mm':'ss"。The custom format string is "yyyy'-'MM'-'dd'T'HH':'mm':'ss". ## Examples 下列範例顯示的值少數的文化特性。The following example displays the value of for a few cultures. summary.span: 取得或設定分隔時間組成部分 (即時、分和秒) 的字串。

span.span: Gets or sets the string that separates the components of time, that is, the hour, minutes, and seconds.

value.span: 分隔時間組成部分的字串。

span.span: The string that separates the components of time.

value.span: 的預設值為 ":"。

span.span: The default for is ":".

remarks.format: ## Remarks 如果自訂模式包含格式模式":"，顯示的值取代":"在格式模式。If the custom pattern includes the format pattern ":", displays the value of in place of the ":" in the format pattern. 時間分隔符號衍生自屬性。The time separator is derived from the property. 我們建議您設定時間分隔符號，簡單地說，或長時間模式，以完全相符的字串，而不是使用時間分隔符號的預留位置。We recommend that you set the time separator in short or long time patterns to an exact string instead of using the time separator placeholder. 例如，若要取得模式為 h-mm-ss，設定模式，以"h-mm-ss"。For example, to obtain the pattern h-mm-ss, set the pattern to "h-mm-ss". 這種做法也可讓您設定模式，例如"h ' mm 是 'ss'"(3 個 h 36 m 12s)，包括多種類型的分隔符號。This practice also enables you to set patterns such as "h'h 'mm'm 'ss's'" (3h 36m 12s) that include multiple types of separators. 屬性定義的取代時間分隔符號的字串 (":"自訂日期和時間格式規範) 在結果字串中，執行格式化作業。The property defines the string that replaces the time separator (":" custom date and time format specifier) in a result string in a formatting operation. 它也會定義剖析作業中的時間分隔符號字串。It also defines the time separator string in a parsing operation. ## Examples 下列範例會具現化物件是 EN-US 文化特性中，變更其日期分隔符號"。"，並使用"t"、"T"、"F"、"f"、"G"和"g"標準格式字串來顯示日期。The following example instantiates a object for the en-US culture, changes its date separator to ".", and displays a date by using the "t", "T", "F", "f", "G", and "g" standard format strings. [!code-csharp[System.Globalization.DateTimeFormatInfo.TimeSeparator#1](~/samples/snippets/csharp/VS_Snippets_CLR_System/system.globalization.datetimeformatinfo.timeseparator/cs/timeseparatorex.cs#1)] [!code-vb[System.Globalization.DateTimeFormatInfo.TimeSeparator#1](~/samples/snippets/visualbasic/VS_Snippets_CLR_System/system.globalization.datetimeformatinfo.timeseparator/vb/timeseparatorex.vb#1)]

summary.span: 取得自訂格式字串，以取得由 ISO 8601 所定義的國際標準、可排序日期和時間字串。

span.span: Gets the custom format string for a universal, sortable date and time string, as defined by ISO 8601.

value.span: 國際標準、可排序日期和時間字串的自訂格式字串。

span.span: The custom format string for a universal, sortable date and time string.

remarks.format: ## Remarks 屬性會定義呼叫所傳回的日期字串的格式和方法和複合格式字串時，會提供"u"標準格式字串。The property defines the format of date strings that are returned by calls to the and methods and by composite format strings that are supplied the "u" standard format string. 它可以用來顯示日期和時間以國際標準時間指示"Z"結尾的排序順序。It can be used to display dates and times in a sortable order with the universal time designator "Z" at the end. 格式是可排序的因為它會使用前置零的年、 月、 日、 小時、 分鐘和秒。The format is sortable because it uses leading zeros for year, month, day, hour, minute, and second. 自訂格式字串 ("yyyy ': ' MM'-' dd HH': 'mm': 'ss'Z'") 相同，不論文化特性或格式提供者。The custom format string ("yyyy'-'MM'-'dd HH':'mm':'ss'Z'") is the same regardless of culture or format provider. 所傳回的格式字串屬性會反映已定義的標準，且屬性為唯讀。The format string returned by the property reflects a defined standard, and the property is read-only. 因此，它一律為相同，不論文化特性為何。Therefore, it is always the same, regardless of the culture. 自訂格式字串為 "yyyy'-'MM'-'dd HH':'mm':'ss'Z'"。The custom format string is "yyyy'-'MM'-'dd HH':'mm':'ss'Z'". ## Examples 下列範例顯示的值少數的文化特性。The following example displays the value of for a few cultures. [!code-cpp[System.Globalization.DateTimeFormatInfo.UniversalSortableDateTimePattern#1](~/samples/snippets/cpp/VS_Snippets_CLR_System/system.Globalization.DateTimeFormatInfo.UniversalSortableDateTimePattern/CPP/dtfi_universalsortabledatetimepattern.cpp#1)] [!code-csharp[System.Globalization.DateTimeFormatInfo.UniversalSortableDateTimePattern#1](~/samples/snippets/csharp/VS_Snippets_CLR_System/system.Globalization.DateTimeFormatInfo.UniversalSortableDateTimePattern/CS/dtfi_universalsortabledatetimepattern.cs#1)] [!code-vb[System.Globalization.DateTimeFormatInfo.UniversalSortableDateTimePattern#1](~/samples/snippets/visualbasic/VS_Snippets_CLR_System/system.Globalization.DateTimeFormatInfo.UniversalSortableDateTimePattern/VB/dtfi_universalsortabledatetimepattern.vb#1)]
